alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:59PM MST until August 21 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY NEAR MAYER... At 659 PM MST, rain has stopped over the area near Mayer. Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms produced heavy rain with totals between 1.25 and 2.5 inches. Flash flooding will remain a threat for the next several hours and is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Isolated showers and storms have the potential to form over the area later this evening. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mayer, Spring Valley, Poland Junction, Cordes Junction, Cordes Lakes, and some areas near Dewey-Humboldt. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 281. Interstate 17 between mile markers 261 and 266. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek, Agua Fria River, Big Bug Creek, Brushy Wash, Yarber Wash, Badger Spring Wash, Cedar Creek, Hackberry Creek, and Sycamore Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
